Reviews.Title: “DON'T DO IT”
Reviews.Author: notoriousM3
Reviews.Content: Lets see where do I begin? I stayed in room 114 9/20-9/22. There were two double beds, and 4 lamps in the room. Only 1 lamp worked, the box spring on both beds were tattered and stained and the frame was not attached to the wall. Its supposed to include eating utensils and pots and pans. There were two plastic cups so worn and stained my wife and I refused to drink out of them. Just for the heck of it I opened the oven and it looks at though it had never been cleaned. There were unknown stains in the bathroon in several areas along with a big wad of dark colored hair in the corner near the bath tub. It looked as though the maids were either on strike or just didn't give a damn. The staff was friendly but that was the only positive about my two nights in this filthy hotel. The television is from the 1980's and there was only 1 chair in the room. I cannot imagine this room being an extended stay. I've seen jail cells with more ambiance. Do yoursel a favor and stay away from this extended stay hell hole!

Reviews.Title: “Visiting Philly”
Reviews.Author: PFS7
Reviews.Content: Generally speaking the hotel was drab and unappealing. Front desk staff was helpful but the property is unattractive. We were upgraded to a much better room than booked an this made the stay tolerable.

Reviews.Title: “Better than Extended Stay - Go Deluxe”
Reviews.Author: BlkLily
Reviews.Content: Initially stayed at an Extended Stay around the corner from the Deluxe because they were out of rooms. That trip was from hell so I was able to stay at the Deluxe for free. The lobby is small and cozy. The exercise room is small as a walk in closet with 3 treadmills. Wi-fi is NOT FREE! I loved the location of our room because it was all the way at the end of hall. We were not between two rooms just one to our left. I was close to the exit and was able to view my car out of my window. I mention that as a plus because guest, I assume they were guest, were in and out constantly! They were leaving rocks to keep the door open. It made me a bit nervous but I guess no one from the street would walk into the hotel. Our room was clean. The bed slept okay, nothing fancy. The big chair had cigarette holes and wires sticking out that it almost tore my shirt. I never sat in the chair due to the holes but hubby found it comfortable. The let out couch was great for the kids. I hated the fridge because you had to stand away from it to open. It was very annoying and it never got cold. The freezer worked well. Bathing the kids was a choir because we had to use a rag to plug the drain. My hubby left his toothbrush and they have signs stating how they could provide you with one. I went to the front desk and they did not have any however fresh sheets and blankets were available. Shopping is close by so if you had to go to the grocery store or to Wal-mart, it is convenient. In conclusion, the bug traps were visible from behind the couch and corners of the bed. It was a free stay and again, I don't think I'd go back. Extended Stay and Extended Stay Deluxe is not for me and my family!

Reviews.Title: “The pipes and doors are NOISY!”
Reviews.Author: ThorDoc
Reviews.Content: On checking in, I went to my room hoping to nap a few hours as my flight was rearranged and I arrived 7 AM. Whenever anyone ran the shower or flushed the toilet in the room next door or across the hall, the pipes were very loud (enough to wake me). Add to that the stain on the carpeting that was gigantic...I would not be inclined to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Caring Service”
Reviews.Author: Isabel056
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Extended Stay (9000 Tinicum Blvd) in Philadelphia for a period of five weeks while in transition to a full time apartment in Philadelphia. The service and staff were wonderful. I needed a shuttle ride to the train station very early each morning back and forth to work (sometimes late at night) and the service was prompt, reliable, and always on time. The room had a great large screen flat panel TV, and all the amenities of a small sized kitchen that was perfect. Best of all, there is a very caring and friendly house staff that didn't miss a beat. The stay was both pleasant and enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the front desk workers”
Reviews.Author: NYtravel516
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel toward the end of July. I planned on staying for only one night, and the following night I was planned on staying in Allentown PA, near Dorney Park. Check in was smooth, I didn't have a problem with anything. The room smelled a little like burnt food, but it is expected with a full kitchen. I did notice the smoke alarms were not plugged up and immediately informed the staff. The trip seemed smooth, I had no problems up until the morning I planned on checking out. Around 8 am, someone called the room asking if we were checking out. We told them we were and they advised us that check out was 11am. We went back to sleep, a little bothered because we didn't ask for a wakeup call. Around 850am, someone knocked, then banged loudly on our door, saying "hello, are you checking out today, hello." I got up and went to the door and said yes, we told them that on the phone, the woman said "okay well check out is at 11am." My husband was furious but I calmed him down and ensured him that it was probably just a mix up. Not even an hour later, the same woman comes to our room and actually attempts to open the door, my husband was in the middle of getting dressed and if the safety lock was not on the door she would have walked in on him undressed! I was completely furious by then and when I went down to check out, I asked for the name of the woman that behaved so rudely. There was a nice young gentlemen, however, that was very apologetic and tried to put us as ease while checking out. He gave us a minor discount and apologized many times afterward. I am not the type to have anyone lose their job over this but she completely ruined my stay. I did not ask again for her name, instead I left, ensuring that I would never go to this particular hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A GREAT FAMILY HOTEL WITH AN OUTDOOR POOL”
Reviews.Author: angelabooker
Reviews.Content: Where can you go with having most of the same amenities of home. Beautiful grounds, wonderful staff and per the kids "Great Pool"...Come bring the family and enjoy a stay out by the pool knowing everyone is safe!!!! My family and I give it 2 thumbs up!!!

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: Fred333Louisiana
Reviews.Content: Had to travel to PA for a funeral. Originally reserved with another hotel chain which was terrible. Made reservations at Extended stay and it was great. Great staff, accomodations. About the only negative comment is there is only one baggage cart for the whole place, so check-in took awhile while we awaited our turn.

Reviews.Title: “Ritz Carlton Service at half the cost!”
Reviews.Author: d6cessful1
Reviews.Content: My family and I get away on weekend trips and vacation in the summer so we generally stay where its comfortable. We encountered a storm which caused the power to go out for several days in Delaware County PA in the middle of a HEAT WAVE. We packed up and drove passed the Extended Stay. I want to let you know that the Front desk staff were very professional friendly and efficient. The Pool was perfect. They made me and my family feel very catered. The staff and the service was as accomodating as the Ritz-Carlton! It was truley a pleasant experience at more than half the cost!!! Thank you. We will be coming back again soon. .-The Mason-Montgomery Family.

Reviews.Title: “Stay only if cost conscious or no other option”
Reviews.Author: koolkash
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the basic amenities for a long duration stay. However nothing is out of the ordinary. Room service is once in a week. The corridors smell of something....probably food. Cost is less compared to other hotels nearby....so is okay if you are looking only from a cost point of view. There is a bus stop right opposite the hotel...for bus to downtown. The train station is 10 minutes walk.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to Airport and great for longer stays”
Reviews.Author: dplrar
Reviews.Content: I also can't understand the bad reviews that are posted for this location. I've stayed here twice through a Priceline Flight/Hotel package and both of the stays were excellent. This is an especially nice choice if you want to save some money and cook your own meals. The rooms we had were equiped with a full size refrigerator, oven, microwave, and dishwasher. The hotel is located close to the airport and has easy access to I-95. The location is in a nice area, and the rooms we had were well kept and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as everyone makes it out”
Reviews.Author: stormcop5
Reviews.Content: This was the first time I had ever stayed at an Extended Stay and I was very pleased with the customer service I recieved from the hotel staff. After reading the bad reviews on this property, I decided to leave one of my own. I work for a company that does work on the local Waste-to-Energy plants, so we stay at several different hotels all over Pennsylvania, Delaware, New Jersey, New York and Mass. The rooms were actually very nice. Sure, there may have been a few stains on the carpet but the room in general was very well kept. The only problem I had was I requested a smoke free room, but it was obvious that the people who had occupied the room prior to my arrival had smoked in the room! When I approached the staff with this fact, they were extremely helpful and provided me with a room air freshiner to help with the smell. The room had very comfortable beds and came with a recliner, a couch and a 25" T.V. equiped with a DVR player. All in all, a very pleasant experience for me. The laundry room was a plus and the grounds are very well kept. Not to mention it is a two minute ride from the airport! I would recommend this hotel to my friends and family!!!

Reviews.Title: “Filthy Dump”
Reviews.Author: DamonCT
Reviews.Content: Frequently I have to book a hotel near the Philadelphia airport on short notice. Sometimes I have to "settle" for this place because everything is fully booked. I can now see why this is the only place with available rooms. These rooms are not properly cleaned. The rooms smell like mold, the bathroom sink is crusty, and even though the bed is made, the sheets are wrinkled and appear as if someone has already slept in them. The corners of the room have some sort of brown crust accumulating. I had to leave and purchase some sanitizing wipes to prevent myself from vomiting. It does not help that people are allowed to cook in their rooms. The entire floor smells like a take-out restaurant. Hotel guests obviously unhappy with their own disgusting food smelling up their rooms put their garbage outside their room in the hallway. The only problem is that this establishment has no maid staff on the premises. Cleaning is only done every few days. Rotting food sitting around for hours on end leaves the entire hotel smelling like a sewer. I felt as though a film of filth was accumulating on me the longer I stayed in the hotel. Interestingly enough I filled out a survey trashing this disgusting establishment. The only thing this accomplished was getting me on Extended Stay's mailing list. Now I get e-mails every other day advertising their hotel rates. Complaining to the staff does nothing. When the person at the desk asked me how my stay was, I told them how horrible it was. He half-heartedly apologized and did nothing else. People only stay here because it is a busy area and it is in a prime location. Do yourself a favor and sleep in your car instead.

Reviews.Title: “?? Not getting the 'dirty, awful' reviews”
Reviews.Author: DivemistressofthDark
Reviews.Content: ?? I didn't think this place was that bad at all. Was really braced for the worst after reading the reviews, so thank heaven it didn't live down to my expectations. I got this hotel on Priceline after picking a "two star" accommodation...apparently it had formerly been rated one star. Paid $75 plus taxes. Firstly, yes, it's an economy hotel. The furnishings weren't opulent but they were decent enough. Looked like someone went to Ikea and bought out the place (although it'd be basic, no frills Ikea stuff, not the fancy rugs and decor.) The bed was very comfortable, I thought (and I'm used to the plushy digs at Hampton Inn, Sheraton, etc). I slept like a log. No loud noises in the hall, the light blocking curtains worked great, lots of good water pressure, air conditioner ran like a champ. Plus my room at least was spotless. Plenty of close, free parking, a relief when you arrive in the wee hours and are walking into the lobby alone. The night watchman let me in well after the lobby closed and gave me a key, no problem. Honestly? I'd gladly stay here again. The free coffee in the lobby was great. The only item I'd add: there's another Extended Stay nearby. Be sure you're at the right one before you unload all your bags.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: speffer
Reviews.Content: I have used priceline to book hotels almost exclusively, and I have never had a problem. This was the first hotel that I can say I would NEVER stay in again. The hotel staff was nice enough, though they wouldn't let us check in even a little bit early and I had a business meeting to go to. They WERE nice enough to let me use their bathroom though. The floors of this hotel (hallways especially) are filthy! I felt dirty the entire time I was there. I brought my own sheets and pillow cases based on some reviews I read after the hotel was booked, and I'm so glad I did. The chair had a very disgusting stain on it, the kitchen and bathroom were ok. The room itself wasn't awful, but it had a really strange smell, and it was a nonsmoking room. The worst part was that someone had put trash in the stairwell (which had trash cans in it, so it wasn't a big deal) and the trash wasn't taken away for THREE days! It smelled awful. Although I love Philly and didn't want my vacation to end, I was more than happy to leave that hotel, and I will not be going back.

Reviews.Title: “The only thing deluxe aout this hotel is in it's name.”
Reviews.Author: patmed
Reviews.Content: Our room smelt of burnt cooking fat. I think this was because it had a dirty oven. I asked if it could be cleaned, they said they would try to get round to it in a few days. The smell was still there when we left three days later. The place was full, so we couldnâ€™t change rooms. In general itâ€™s not particularly clean and in desperate need of a face lift. If you use the internet they charge you $4.99 to connect. If you can find somewhere else to stay, do so!

Reviews.Title: “DUMP!”
Reviews.Author: Coolio2000
Reviews.Content: What a complete Dump! I can't believe that I subjected my family to such a filthy hotel. The carpets were stained, bathrooms partly cleaned, stained linens, and the list goes on. The staff seemed liked they could care less when I expressed my concerns. Stay Away!

Reviews.Title: “Great for long term stay”
Reviews.Author: num1mnmeater
Reviews.Content: To begin with, this area near the airport is expensive, but for a long term stay this is the place to go if you are sharing a room. Very nice rooms with laundry machines onsite, continental breakfast Mon-Fri, full kitchenettes, wireless internet. Not many restaurants or stores nearby though. They do have the front doors locked after evening hours and a rental security person roaming around.

Reviews.Title: “Rude staff, filthy room, no amenities...”
Reviews.Author: GateGuy
Reviews.Content: Horrible hotel, worst I've ever been in and I travel for a living. There's no airport shuttle, their "complimentary breakfast" was unavailable on the weekends and too late on the weekdays to be of any use. When I complained about it, the staff was downright mean. Room was filthy, with stains on the carpets and burn marks on the counters. Uniformed security guard was lurking around the lobby all the time, so it didn't feel like the safest location either. I got a great deal on this room, and it still wasn't worth the price I paid. I won't even use the "complimentary stay" they've offered me to make up for this terrible experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in Philadelphia”
Reviews.Author: andertall
Reviews.Content: We only learned of the negative reviews for this hotel after it had been booked for us on Priceline. Somewhat wary of Priceline's choice, we nevertheless proceeded to Philly from Washington DC for quick overnight on the weekend. The hotel is within view of the airport, which makes it convenient getting to and from that location. We weren't flying, so I can't comment on exactly how convenient. The lobby was sparse and clean, which is what was expected from this type of hotel- basic accomodation. If you are looking for fancy, look elsewhere. The desk help was friendly and efficient, and check-in was a breeze. The room itself was on the 3rd floor, and was much bigger than anticipated. It had a small kitchen, complete with flatware and other utensils, dishwasher, toaster, micorwave, and refrigerator. In addition to the queen-size bed was a sofa pullout in case you have additional sleepy travelers. There was also a comfortable la-z-boy recliner for those so inclined. The air conditioner worked fine as well. The bathroom was large and spotlessly clean. No complaints there. This was a very pleasant place to stay, and we would stay there again, as well as recommending this hotel to others wanting a simple, clean place to crash in Philadelphia. We drove in from DC, so I am not sure whether or not there is a hotel shuttle to and from the airport, but for us, a car was necessary to get into the city- about a 15-minute drive north to Philly. Overall, the Extended Stay Deluxe was perfect for our needs.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Ever”
Reviews.Author: lv2travel_73
Reviews.Content: Rude, dirty, absolutely unprofessional. Does not deserve to be called part of the "hospitality" industry. My flight arrived late due to weather delays. As this is one of the only hotels near airport without a shuttle I had to take a cab. When I arrived the night clerk was utterly furious that I had the gall to arrive late at night and proceeded to yell at and belittle me. To make matters worse, he could not find my reservation. He continued to yell at me and refused to honor the price I'd been quoted by Priceline. In the end, I walked out and across the street to the Mariott Courtyard. It was like leaving hell for heaven.

Reviews.Title: “wouldnt bother”
Reviews.Author: Elvisneverlied
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night while waiting for my flight since I was taking the train both to the hotel and to the airport the next day the fact that it was the furthiest hotel from the trainstation mattered to me the room was of good size and had a fridge but I had to unplug the lamp in order to turn it off the next morning I saw a couple of cock roaches and thats when I decided that I wouldnt be staying at extend stay again with other choices I will try something else next time

Reviews.Title: “No Airport Shuttle Service/No Room Guarantee”
Reviews.Author: tsimmis
Reviews.Content: 1. There is no airport shuttle. 2. I prepaid for a guaranteed reservation. After paying for a cab to get there from the airport, I was told there were no rooms! The travel co. tried to contact both the hotel and the main ESA # to get the reservation straightened out. No one answered the phone!

Reviews.Title: “what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It was inexpensive and served as a place to sleep. The room smelled like smoke and the pool is only open during the summer months. It is located around many other hotels with a "Ruby Tuesday" restaurant one hundred yards away. The staff was friendly and helpful. It is not a place to take your family, but for a two night stay with a kitchen it was a good deal. No continental breakfast, but fast food restaurants are only minutes away. It is not in a scary part of town, it is literally surrounded by other larger hotels with ample parking lot lighting.

Reviews.Title: “Walked in...Walked right out- Dirty, stained carpet, bathroom & kitchen”
Reviews.Author: Katbenn8
Reviews.Content: I asked to look at the room prior to paying (Had a gut feeling) I generally do stay at Extended Stay hotels, and love the conviences. This place needs cleaning up. No reason for the stained, cruddy bathroom, kitchen & carpets.

Reviews.Title: “You Get What You Pay For”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Need I say more. Terrible location, ugly rooms, and small. Only as a last resort.

Reviews.Title: “I Have Just One Complaint”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My Fiance and I absolutely adore Studio Plus in Philadelphia. What we don't like about it is, when we register for a room and they take our credit card information, they actually charge our card "twice". Once when we make the reservation, and again when we check out, we are charged again. Then we have to call the bank when we get home and have the bank cancel the second charge. We don't feel that the Studio Plus should be double charging us like that. But, other than that, we abolutely love staying there, and we stay there quite often. We figure that the one complaint will not overpower the positive feelings that we have about the Studio Plus. We just wanted to bring it to your attention and hopefully there can be some resolution to the problem of double charging customers. Our overall rating for this hotel = 9 out of 10.

HotelInfo.Name: Extended Stay Deluxe Philadelphia-Airport
HotelInfo.Address: 8880 Bartram Ave, Philadelphia, PA 19153
